searchDocs.content: </> Base.MoveProp( self: Base, propId: string, positionData: BaseUtil.PositionData ) → () Pivots a prop on the server which will update the prop's position on all clients

searchDocs.title: initControllers​
searchDocs.content: </> Bootstrap.initControllers(root: Folder ) → () Initiates any controllers found in the given path that have a file name ending with "Controller"

searchDocs.title: CollectionObject
searchDocs.content: On this page CollectionObject Show Private CollectionObject is a wrapper for CollectionService instances found using CollectionWatcher. It provides a Destroyed signal that fires when the object is removed from the game as an alternative to using CollectionService:GetInstanceRemovedSignal(). Example usage: local ReplicatedStorage = game:GetService("ReplicatedStorage") local CollectionWatcher = require(ReplicatedStorage.Shared.Class.CollectionWatcher) local Util = require(ReplicatedStorage.Packages.Util) local killPart: CollectionWatcher.CollectionWatcher<BasePart> = CollectionWatcher.new("KILL_PART") -- Add a handler for kill parts killPart:RegisterHandler(function(object: CollectionWatcher.CollectionObject<BasePart>) object.context.Touched:Connect(function(part: BasePart) local humanoid: Humanoid? = part.Parent:FindFirstChildOfClass("Humanoid") or part.Parent.Parent:FindFirstChildOfClass("Humanoid") if humanoid then humanoid.Health = 0 end end) object.Destroyed:Connect(function() -- Play sparkle VFX where the object used to be end) end)

searchDocs.title: Component
searchDocs.content: Component A class that represents a component in the application. It is used Usage: local function MyComponent() local component = Component.new({ root = Instance.new("Frame"), }) component.Init:Connect(function() -- Initialization code here end) component.Mounted:Connect(function() -- Mounted code here end) return component end -- In a route Root:UseComponent(MyComponent())

searchDocs.title: DefaultProps
searchDocs.content: DefaultProps This was created because React currently does not have a way to set default properties for components. DefaultProps is a higher-order function that takes a table of default properties and returns a function that takes a table of properties. The returned function will merge the default properties with the provided properties and return the result. local DefaultProps = require(src.Util.DefaultProps) local defaultProps = { foo = "bar", } local createProps = DefaultProps(defaultProps) local MyReactComponent = function(props) props = createProps(props) print(props.foo) -- "bar" end MyReactComponent()

searchDocs.title: new​
searchDocs.content: </> CollectionWatcher.new() → CollectionWatcher Creates a new CollectionWatcher for the given tag

searchDocs.title: GetAll​
searchDocs.content: </> CollectionWatcher:GetAll() → {CollectionObject} Returns all CollectionObjects in the collection.

searchDocs.title: RegisterHandler​
searchDocs.content: </> CollectionWatcher:RegisterHandler(callback: (object: CollectionObject<T>) → ()) → RBXScriptConnection -- The connection to the Added signal Fires the callback for all existing objects and connects it to the Added signal Use the Added signal to listen for new objects without firing the callback for existing objects.

searchDocs.title: Destroy​
searchDocs.content: </> CollectionWatcher:Destroy() → () Disconnects all signals and stops listening for new objects. This does not destroy any objects from the game.

searchDocs.title: Device
searchDocs.content: Device This item only works when running on the client. Client Author: Javi (dig1t) Utility module for handling device-specific information and events. Breakpoints are thresholds that trigger responsive elements to resize/reshape. They are used for adjust UI to different screen sizes and devices.

searchDocs.content: </> FeatureFlags.get(flag: string) → boolean Returns whether a feature flag is enabled.

searchDocs.title: set​
searchDocs.content: </> FeatureFlags.set( flag: string, value: boolean ) → () Sets the value of a feature flag.

searchDocs.title: waitFor​
searchDocs.content: </> InstanceSync.waitFor( root: Instance , instanceData: {[string]: InstanceData}, timeout: number?--Optionaltimeoutinseconds ) → {[string]: any} Equivalent to using WaitForChild()

searchDocs.title: getRecordsByItemId​
searchDocs.content: </> InventoryService.getRecordsByItemId( player: Player , itemId: string ) → {Types.ItemRecord}? Grabs all items in the player's inventory that match the given itemId. Since multiple records can hold the same itemId, this function must return a table of records instead of a single record.

searchDocs.title: PlacementController
searchDocs.content: On this page PlacementController Show Private Author: Javi (dig1t) This controller handles prop placement on the client. Current features: prop highlighting dragging props prop placement, rotation, and removal prop hotswapping (swapping currently selected prop with another) prop placement validation (checking if the prop can be placed at the desired position) grid snapping

searchDocs.title: _reloadProps​
searchDocs.content: </> Plot._reloadProps( self: Plot, plotData: BaseUtil.PlotData-- The saved configuration of the floor to load (From the player's data) ) → () Erases all existing props placed down on the floor and reloads w/the provided FloorConfiguration table

searchDocs.title: fetch​
searchDocs.content: </> ProfileService.fetch( player: Player , payload: {string}?-keysofvaluestoget( ifnil, returnsentireprofiledata ) ) → tablewithvaluesretrieved,thekeyofeachvalueisthegivenpath Returns a table of values from a player's data. If no payload is given, the entire player data table is returned.

searchDocs.title: MoveTo​
searchDocs.content: This item only works when running on the server. Server </> PropBaseClass.MoveTo( self: Prop, newCFrame: CFrame , newPositionData: BaseUtil.PositionData ) → () Called by the Base class when a prop's positionData is updated.

searchDocs.title: PropController
searchDocs.content: PropController Author: dig1t PropController is responsible for managing all prop replicas in the game. It listens for new prop replicas and hitboxes, and creates PropBaseClass instances for them. It also provides methods to get props by ID and handle prop-related events.

searchDocs.title: Route
searchDocs.content: Route A class that represents a route in the application. It is used to manage the state and lifecycle of a route. Portals are routes that are not directly navigable. They are used to mount routes in different locations in the UI tree. Portals persist across route changes and are not unmounted when navigating to a different route.

searchDocs.title: ShopItems
searchDocs.content: ShopItems Handles the item data for the shop and crates. Item Data Structure: All item IDs must be unique and in number format IDs cannot be changed later on to avoid issues with players that have the item in their inventory.

searchDocs.title: new​
searchDocs.content: </> Spring.new( initial: T,-- Initial value smoothTime: number,-- Approximate time it takes to reach target maxSpeed: number-- Maximum speed (defaults to infinity) ) → Spring<T> Creates a new spring. The type T can be a number, Vector2, Vector3, or CFrame.

searchDocs.title: Update​
searchDocs.content: </> Spring:Update(deltaTime: number) → T Updates the spring. This method should be called continuously, even if the target value hasn't changed. local newValue = spring:Update(deltaTime)

searchDocs.title: Impulse​
searchDocs.content: </> Spring:Impulse(velocity: T) → () Impulses the spring. spring:Impulse(rng:NextUnitVector() * 10)

searchDocs.title: Reset​
searchDocs.content: </> Spring:Reset(value: T) → () Resets the spring to the given value.

searchDocs.title: useEffect​
searchDocs.content: </> useEffect.useEffect( runner: () → Maid.MaidTask?,-- The function to run when the component mounts and when the dependencies change. dependencies: {State.State<any>} | State.State<any>-- The dependencies to watch for changes. If any of these change, the runner will be called ) → Maid.Maid-- A maid that will clean up the effect when the component unmounts or when the dependencies change.

searchDocs.title: bases
searchDocs.content: bases BasesAll base styles are required to have the following: Must be a ModelPrimaryPart is setContainers a "Points" folder containing: "Plot" folder containing plot points named by their plot number (e.g. "1") A list of required plot points are in src/Shared/Class/BaseUtil "Spawn" part"TradePost" part
